lead_paragraph: As President Raúl Castro of Cuba stammered over questions from the news media, it was a reminder of the signs of regression concerning President Obama and the press back home.

headline.print_headline: Victory Lap and Wink, as 2 Presidents Meet
headline.main: A Castro Met a Free Press, and the World Watched It Live

snippet: As President Raúl Castro of Cuba stammered over questions from the news media, it was a reminder of the signs of regression concerning President Obama and the press back home.
abstract: Jim Rutenberg Mediator column contrasts joint press conference given by Pres Obama and Cuban Pres Raul Castro, which was remarkable in light of Cuba's restricted press freedoms, with increasing opacity of Obama's own administration; expresses concern that administration's treatment of press, including slow fulfillment of Freedom of Information Act requests, is eroding health of fourth estate.
